intro: Disporopsis arisanensis, commonly known as the Arisan disporum, is a rare flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountainous forests. It is noted for its delicate appearance and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
